results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.

results.title: You've changed
results.brief_description: From the time he was awarded a Churchill Fellowship in 1969, Conrad’s life has been one of achievement. A skilled builder, a respected intellect and an icon in forestry aviation, Conrad now needs full-time care due to dementia. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: This is for you Richard and Cath
results.brief_description: Dedicated to her son and daughter, Lesley’s tribute to her late husband recalls the love they shared for each other. From the place where they first met, to the last place they spent time together. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ workshop in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: Pride and diversity
results.brief_description: ‘Pride and Diversity’ was a program of digital storytelling workshops with multiple groups focussed on community issues and cultural diversity. In partnership with VicHealth, City of Stonington, City of Melbourne, Kensington Association, Kensington Women’s Dinner, Kensington Storytelling Festival ‘ community storytellers, Quiksound Productions- City of Monash FReeZA committee, Minus 18, Inside Out Group, Pride & Diversity group- Monash Youth & Family Services, Roleplay, Soundslike ‘ City of Stonington’s FreeZA committee, Go Girl Go, Young Mum’s program, The Club, Girls Own - YWCA

results.title: The Sound of Hip Hop
results.brief_description: Karim, a music teacher who works in Kensington with African youth, relates how he first discovered Hip Hop and started his love affair with music. Created as part of the ‘Kensington Stories’ ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the Kensington Storytelling Festival and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: My inspiration
results.brief_description: In this short, the narrator tells us how her son provides her with daily inspiration to live a good life. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: Like they used to
results.brief_description: A short story about a Kensington cobbler’s shop that sends a message about our increasingly disposable consumer culture. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: Kensington Women's Dinner
